name: 餐旅經營管理研究
description:
This is an advanced-level course that covers complex issues facing hospitality industry leaders today. This course will prepare students to become entry-level
managers in the hospitality industry by exposing them to contemporary operational issues and situations, equipping them with various problem solving methods and teaching them to develop and implement strategic
solutions. Topics covered include guest service, leadership, strategic planning, trends and technology, communication, marketing, human resource management, and crisis management. Class content is delivered
through lectures, group discussion, learning activities, and case studies.
goals: Evaluate the trends toward internationalization of hospitality industry.
Explain the nature of hospitality service in the global market.
Describe the opportunities of hospitality organizations to expand globally
Stress the importance of the customer in the design and running of a hospitality operation.
Demonstrate the importance of the concept and location of hospitality operations.
Review the key control areas of the management of hospitality systems.
Tie together the various courses in the curriculum into the development of a business plan and operational procedures for hospitality operations
